intro: Kyllinga echinata, commonly known as spikeleaf spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Nyctaginaceae and is characterized by its upright, sparsely branched stems. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Kyllinga echinata is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats including gardens and roadside areas.
